meanings.definition: To look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter.
meanings.sent1: She reads the book slowly to understand the story.
meanings.sent2: He reads the newspaper every morning to stay informed.
meanings.sent3: The cat reads the sign on the door and decides to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The smile on her face reads happiness to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: His expression reads confusion as he tries to solve the puzzle.

meanings.definition: To interpret or understand the meaning of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reads the student's essay to grasp the message.
meanings.sent2: She reads the map carefully to find the right direction.
meanings.sent3: The parrot reads the gestures of its owner and mimics them.
meanings.sent4: His silence reads disappointment louder than words could.
meanings.sent5: The detective reads the clues and solves the mystery in no time.

meanings.definition: To indicate or show a particular figure or amount when measured or recorded.
meanings.sent1: The scale reads his weight accurately.
meanings.sent2: The thermometer reads the temperature in the room.
meanings.sent3: The clock reads the time, but he's still late.
meanings.sent4: The gauge reads the pressure, warning of potential danger.
meanings.sent5: The meter reads the electricity usage for the month.

meanings.definition: To have a particular quality or impression when read or perceived.
meanings.sent1: Her poem reads beautifully, touching the hearts of many.
meanings.sent2: The painting reads as a masterpiece to art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The weather reads unpredictability, changing every hour.
meanings.sent4: His face reads determination as he prepares for the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The landscape reads serenity, calming all who gaze upon it.
